pull.title: cmake: Specify Windows plugin path in `test_bitcoin-qt` property
pull.body:
This PR simplifies testing on Windows by removing the need to set the `QT_PLUGIN_PATH` environment variable for different build configurations. For example, the paths might otherwise be:
- `C:/Users/hebasto/dev/bitcoin/build/vcpkg_installed/x64-windows/Qt6/plugins/` for "Release"
- `C:/Users/hebasto/dev/bitcoin/build/vcpkg_installed/x64-windows/debug/Qt6/plugins/` for "Debug"

Tested on Windows  and the Qt test runs successfully without requiring manual QT_PLUGIN_PATH environment  setup.

 Approved

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,11 +40,15 @@ add_test(NAME test_bitcoin-qt
   COMMAND test_bitcoin-qt
 )
 if(WIN32 AND VCPKG_TARGET_TRIPLET)
-  # On Windows, vcpkg configures Qt with `-opengl dynamic`, which makes
-  # the "minimal" platform plugin unusable due to internal Qt bugs.
-  set_tests_properties(test_bitcoin-qt PROPERTIES
-    ENVIRONMENT "QT_QPA_PLATFORM=windows"
+  set(plugin_path "$<SHELL_PATH:$<PATH:GET_PARENT_PATH,$<PATH:GET_PARENT_PATH,$<TARGET_PROPERTY:Qt6::QWindowsIntegrationPlugin,LOCATION_$<CONFIG>>>>>")
comments.body:
I think the `_$<CONFIG>` part is unnecessary, because the value of the `LOCATION` property is already config dependent.

`$<PATH:GET_*,...>` requires CMake version 3.24.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,11 +40,15 @@ add_test(NAME test_bitcoin-qt
   COMMAND test_bitcoin-qt
 )
 if(WIN32 AND VCPKG_TARGET_TRIPLET)
-  # On Windows, vcpkg configures Qt with `-opengl dynamic`, which makes
-  # the "minimal" platform plugin unusable due to internal Qt bugs.
-  set_tests_properties(test_bitcoin-qt PROPERTIES
-    ENVIRONMENT "QT_QPA_PLATFORM=windows"
+  set(plugin_path "$<SHELL_PATH:$<PATH:GET_PARENT_PATH,$<PATH:GET_PARENT_PATH,$<TARGET_PROPERTY:Qt6::QWindowsIntegrationPlugin,LOCATION_$<CONFIG>>>>>")
comments.body:
> I think the `_$<CONFIG>` part is unnecessary, because the value of the `LOCATION` property is already config dependent.

Are you sure about that? I tested your suggestion, and it returns the path to the â€œReleaseâ€ plugin when building with `--config Debug`.

> `$<PATH:GET_*,...>` requires CMake version 3.24.

I think it's safe, as the version of CMake shipped with Visual Studio was [updated to 3.24.1](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/overview/what-s-new-for-visual-cpp-in-visual-studio#whats-new-for-c-in-visual-studio-version-174) starting from version 17.4. The current minimum required Visual Studio version is [17.13](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/build-windows-msvc.md#1-visual-studio). And this code is reachable only on Windows with vcpkg.

   COMMAND test_bitcoin-qt
 )
 if(WIN32 AND VCPKG_TARGET_TRIPLET)
-  # On Windows, vcpkg configures Qt with `-opengl dynamic`, which makes
-  # the "minimal" platform plugin unusable due to internal Qt bugs.
-  set_tests_properties(test_bitcoin-qt PROPERTIES
-    ENVIRONMENT "QT_QPA_PLATFORM=windows"
+  set(plugin_path "$<SHELL_PATH:$<PATH:GET_PARENT_PATH,$<PATH:GET_PARENT_PATH,$<TARGET_PROPERTY:Qt6::QWindowsIntegrationPlugin,LOCATION_$<CONFIG>>>>>")
comments.body:
> it returns the path to the â€œReleaseâ€ plugin when building with `--config Debug`.

Interesting. I put that in my backlog. Low priority, because your approach is working. I just want to know why the `LOCATION` property is not set correctly.
